definition: to be an eyesore/(fig.) to spoil the fun/to be a wet blanket
fiend/demon/very/(Tw) SARS (loanword)
to terminate/to cut short/to bring to a stop/to squeeze/to tighten/to damage/variant of 殺|杀[sha1]
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
surname Jing
bright/circumstance/scenery
see 大殺風景|大杀风景[da4 sha1 feng1 jing3]

sentences.english: The teenagers don't invite Bob to their parties because he is a wet blanket.
sentences.chinese: 少年们不邀请鲍伯参加舞会，因为他常煞风景。

sentences.english: Only on hearing this did he change his mind. This unpleasant event made me quite unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 这次大煞风景的导游，令我颇为不快。

sentences.english: At such a happy moment , please stop saying unpleasant things.
sentences.chinese: 在这愉快的时刻，你不要说煞风景的话。

sentences.english: A tourist spot covered with trash is a real eyesore.
sentences.chinese: 旅游景点遍地垃圾，总会让人觉得大煞风景。

sentences.english: One answer to these questions is that nobody likes a party pooper .
sentences.chinese: 以上问题的一个解释是没人喜欢煞风景的人。

sentences.english: What a killjoy shitbag he is.
sentences.chinese: 他真是个煞风景的屎蛋。

sentences.english: The forecast of rain cast a wet blanket over our picnic plan.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报有雨，使我们的野餐计划大煞风景。

sentences.english: In another situation, the wife thing would have been a deal-breaker.
sentences.chinese: 在其他情况下，有妻子可能就很煞风景。

definition: see 大殺風景|大杀风景[da4 sha1 feng1 jing3]
variant of 煞風景|煞风景[sha1 feng1 jing3]
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
untimely/premature/inopportune/ill-timed/out of fashion/behind the times
lit. to burn zithers and cook cranes/fig. to waste valuable resources/to destroy wantonly beautiful things
to be a blot on the landscape/to dampen spirits/to spoil the fun/to be a wet blanket
to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
disappointed
timely/at the right moment/appropriate to the occasion/opportune/to fit current fashion
to spoil one's appetite/fig. to get fed up with sth
annoying/disgusting
embarrassed
not according with decorum (idiom); scandalous/bad form/unacceptable behavior
lacking in class/tacky/tasteless
unpleasant/disagreeable
eccentric/peculiar/mystifying
